titles.title: Dǝggwa, Antiphonary for the entire year / Mǝʿǝraf, The Common of the Office

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dǝggwa, Antiphonary for the entire year (fols. 2ra-57rc) II) Mǝʿǝraf, The Common of the Office (57rc-105rc) II-1) Kǝśtät zä-ʾaryam, The festive Office (fols. 57rc-63rc) II-2) Wazema, The Office of Vigils (fols. 63rc-70va) II-3) Sǝbḥatä nägh, The Office of Matins (fols. 70va-75rc) II-4) Mäwäddǝs, The Sunday Office (fols. 75rc-102va, 103ra-105rc)
Additiones 1-3.

copyists.copyist: Wäldä Gäbrä Nazrawi (hand b) is mentioned as the scribe of the pen trial in Additio 3.

txstates.txstate: The back board is repaired with a thread of vegetal origin. The sewing is damaged. In quire I, one bifolio (leaves 2 and 9) is of smaller size. Holes are carefully amended on fols. 5, 6, 62, 68.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the back board is broken and repaired with a thread of vegetal origin). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: I(9; s.l.: 1, stub after 9/fols. 1r-9v) – II(8/fols. 10r-17v) – III(8/fols. 18r-25v) – IV(8/fols. 26r-33v) – IV(8/fols. 34r-41v) – V(8/fols. 42r-49v) – VI(8/fols. 50r-57v) – VII(8/fols. 58r-65v) – VIII(6/fols. 66r-71v) – IX(8/fols. 72r-79v) – X(10/fols. 80r-89v) – XI(9; s.l.: 1, stub after 9/fols. 90r-98v) – XII(8; s.l.: 4, stub after 4; 8, stub before 1/fols. 99r-106v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Stuctural pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written below the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling. Three ruled lines at the bottom of fol. 91 were not used by the scribe. The bottom ruled line on fols. 103r-104r was not used by the scribe.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: fine, regular; hand b: poor, ill-trained; hand c: mediocre

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 2ra-90rc, Hand b: fol. 90rc-vc Hand c: fols. 91ra-105rc

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals and/or their elements. Text I Names of sections followed by feast names (e.g., wazema zä-sänabǝt ʾElsabeṭ, wazema zä-ʾarbaʿǝtu ʾǝnsǝsa); names of antiphons and their abbreviations (e.g., maḫlet, mäzmur, śäläst, sälam, bä-5-tu, ʾabun, ʾaryam, ʾǝsmä lä-ʿaläm, zä-ʾamlakiyä, zä-yǝʾǝze, yǝtbaräk); names of other chants and their abbreviations (e.g., mǝlṭan, mǝsbak, ʿǝzl); musical notation: intratextual signs (e.g., sǝräyu, nǝʿu). A group of lines on the incipit page of the text. Text II Initial line of Texts II-1 to II-IV; names of antiphons and chants, and their abbreviations (e.g., mǝqnay, mǝlṭan, mäzmur, sälam, ʾaryam, qǝne); initial words of supplications, antiphons and other chants, and their sections (e.g., yǝtbaräk, sǝbḥǝwwo, qalǝyä, täśahalänni, ʾantä, täkäśtä, sǝmʿanni); names of feasts and other occasions.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ምል፡/ ማኅሌ፡ for ምልጣን፡ ማ፡/ማኅ፡ for ማኅሌት፡ ም፡ for ምስባክ፡ ስ፡/ስብ፡/ስብሐ፡ for ስብሐተ፡ ነግህ፡ ሰላ፡ for ሰላም፡ ይት፡/ይትባ፡ for ይትባረክ፡ ቃለ፡/ቃለ፡ ዓ፡ for ቃለ፡ ዓዋዲ፡ እስ፡/እስመ፡ ለዓ፡/እስ፡ ለዓ for እስመ፡ ለዓለም፡ ግዕ፡ for ግዕዝ፡ ዘይእ፡ for ዘይእዜ መዝ፡ for መዝሙር፡ ዕዝ፡ for ዕዝል፡ ምዕራ፡ for ምዕራፍ፡ ዓራ፡ for ዓራራይ፡

additional.cont: Fol. 105rc: Excerpt from Dǝggwa (Antiphonary) for Good Thursday.
additional.det: The note is written in the same hand as Additio 2.

additional.cont: Fol. 105va: Excerpt from Zǝmmare (Eucharistic hymns).
additional.det: The note is written in the same hand as Additio 1.

additional.cont: Fol. 106r: An antiphon dedicated to St George (cp. fol. 98rc).
additional.det: The note is written in hand b, apparently as a writing exercise. Below the note there is a pen trial signed by Wäldä Gäbrä Nazrawi.

extras.extra: - Cues for rubricators: fols. 58rv, 59rv, 69v, 70rv, 71v, 72rv, 73r, 74rv, 75r, 76rv, 81v, 82r, 83rv, 84rv, 85rv, 86rv, 88v, 101v, 102r, 104r. - Directives for the ministers are written in the upper margin, in a secondary hand: fols. 59vbc, 70va. - Tämälläs-sign, in the shape of a cross, indicating the place where the omissions, written in the upper margin in the main hand, belong: fols. 2vb l.8, 14ra l.10, 61rc l.7, 61vb l.16, 62va l.8, 62va l.14, 66ra l.15, 66va l.16, 70rb l.14, 70va l.1, 72va l.1, 75rb l.4, 76vc l.2, 78va l.8, 80vb l. 18, 81vc l.9. - Tämälläs-sign, in the shape of a cross, indicating the place where the omissions, written interlineally in the main hand, belong: fols. 80vc l.20, 80vc l.21, 82va l.15, 86ra l.20. - Omitted passages written in the margins: fols. 69vc, 79rc, 91rc, 93rb, 93vb, 95rc, 96rab, 97rb, 97v, 99vb, 100rb. - Pen trial: fols. 92r, 99r, 106r. - Scribbles: fols. 102v, 103r, 105v, 106r.

frames.frame: Fols. 38rb, 63rc: simple uncoloured ornamental band; interlaces. Fol. 96vc: crude, simple ornamental band.
